Another event of a non-specific nature (Reader's choice)
13415111121111.content:
It had certainly been an interesting evening for Liz. She trusted Steven enough to let him keep an eye on Ethan, after the babysitter had left. It was something the real Courtney would normally do while Liz got changed and made dinner for the family. Actually most days a babysitter wasn't required, Courtney would collect him from school and look after him.

This was considered part of her contribution to the household for her accommodation. She wasn't working and couldn't contribute financially. She was permitted the odd day off and today just happened to be one of them.

Liz popped her head into the living room to find both of them watching television which was fairly typical behaviour for Courtney. The only difference was Steven seemed genuinely interested in the television show. Courtney would generally have her head stuck in her phone while she 'looked after' her little brother.

When Eric got in from work, Steven did a good job at pretending to be Courtney. Actually a slightly better job as he asked about his day. Normally Courtney would do little more than grunt an acknowledgement when he got in.

During dinner, Steven handled the conversation well. Eric hardly noticed anything amiss. Liz did have to prompt him a few times in the conversation when he got stuck. Every time he called her 'mum', Eric secretly glanced at Liz with a smile. Liz returned Eric's looks with one of surprise, like she had no idea about why Courtney was calling her that.

After dinner Steven helped with the dishes which was more than Courtney usually offered to do. Afterwards Steven also joined 'her' dad and step-mum in the living room. This was extremely out of character for Courtney. Steven even engaged in the various discussions. Liz considered this out of character for Steven too, who was normally quite quiet and introverted.

Liz still felt the whole situation was bizarre with this infiltrator pretending to be a family member. He wasn't exactly a stranger though. Liz and Steven spoke to each other most days. It was Liz herself who had talked Steven into becoming the assistant supervisor. She wouldn't do that for a stranger. They had known each other a long time, over ten years at Wilkos. Liz had in fact known him much longer than Eric and Courtney.

"What do you think she's after?" Eric asked his wife, when Steven went to the bathroom. Liz had been watching the television and turned to her husband sitting beside her on the sofa.

"You think she's up to something?" Liz asked back.

"Look at how helpful she's been and she keeps calling you 'mum'." Eric couldn't help but laugh. "She's buttering us up for some reason."

"Maybe she's just becoming a bit more mature, putting all the uncaring step-mother nonsense behind her." Liz thought she managed to sound plausible. Eric gave her a sceptical shrug. Their conversation was cut short by Steven's return.

When Eric took Ethan up the stairs to bed, Liz took the opportunity to speak to Steven. "What do you think you are playing at?" She asked him.

"I don't understand." He said.

"Being nice, respectful and actually talking to me and Eric like human beings." Liz stated.

"And that's a bad thing?" A confused Steven asked. Liz hadn't intended for it to come out like that.

"No, obviously but what I meant was, it's not how Courtney acts." She quickly corrected herself.

"Can't I be a little more like myself? Is that so terrible?" Liz didn't really see much of Steven either but let it slide for now.

"Of course but gradually. You can't go from grouchy, distant twenty-something to contestant for the daughter of the year award in the space of a day. Eric's already suspicious."

"I'm sorry mum." Steven looked upset. Calling her mum actually made Liz feel a little guilty even though she was still annoyed with him.

"For future reference, usually Courtney disappears to her room after dinner. I thought you'd be keen to check out 'your stuff'."

"I don't know where it is." Steven told her. Liz found this hard to believe.

"You managed to find the chuffing toilet." Some of Liz's earlier resentment about the body stealing was coming through.

"I used it when you had the barbecue." Liz and her family had a large barbecue here the previous summer, she had invited a few of her work colleagues too.

"You should just have checked the rooms quietly when we were all down here. I'm sure you could have picked out which one belonged to you." She found herself talking exactly the same as when she explained things to her less capable subordinates at work.

"Oh, yeah." Steven said as if it was the most obvious thing in the world after he heard it.

"I thought Courtney explained all this stuff?" A now frustrated Liz asked.

"I was just so excited about the swap," Steven paused, "I might not have been paying attention." Liz stared at him. Steven didn't want to piss off Liz any more than he already had. "I guess time is getting on, I really should go check it out." He stood up and quickly left.

Liz sighed and leaned back on the sofa. Relieved to get peace at last she felt her body relaxing as she heard Steven walking away. She was caught by surprise when Steven reappeared, sticking his head round the door. He gave her a gormless smile. Liz rolled her eyes. "The door to the right of the toilet." Steven nodded and disappeared again.

---

Emma lay in a deep bath sipping a glass of wine. It felt wonderful. Her new body was feeling a little tender from earlier and the bath was the perfect remedy.

All the way through dinner she half expected to be called out for being a fraud. She couldn't help but watch Alice act her normal self in Emma's own body. She was even wearing one of Alice's own outfits. It seemed perfectly normal to her to be a forty seven year old woman dressed as a teenager.

After dinner Emma quickly excused herself and headed upstairs. She had a quick look at her own wardrobe as she prepared for her bath. All her own clothes were there. She checked her underwear and found all her bras were now B-cups. All her clothing had adjusted for her new body. Even a pair of shoes that were too tight on her were still too tight even though her feet were down a size too.

Emma was brought back to the present when Kyle walked into the bathroom. She felt a bit weird being naked around him but thankfully the bubble bath suds covered her up to her shoulders.

"Sorry, luv I was dying for a pee. I couldn't wait any longer." Kyle said as he turned his back to Emma and went to use the toilet.

"What time is it?" Emma asked.

"Half nine." He said. Emma nearly spat out her wine. She'd been here nearly two hours. Kyle had been drinking beer, he must have been at bursting point.

"Sorry, it's been a long day." Emma told him.

"How's the migraine?" He asked as he finished up and turned back around.

"A little better." She lied. That was her excuse for not having sex later.

"Maybe the wine will help." He said smiling. Emma shook her head. "You never know." Kyle lived in hope.

"No. The wine isn't dulling the throbbing at all. I think this is going to be a bad one." Emma said, feeling a little regretful about fibbing to her husband.

---

Alice rolled over in her bed. She was incredibly tired but unable to fall asleep. The doctor had told her sleeplessness was a common symptom of early menopause. She knew it was something she had to live with. It didn't help that she could hear her parents talking in their bed. She couldn't make out the words but the constant murmur of two different voices was stopping her from relaxing.

Alice was definitely planning on moving her bed. This wall had the radiator on it but it was also right next to her parent's room. She rolled over again, hoping facing away from the wall would help. It didn't and now her clock was in her face reminding her how slowly time was passing. Eventually the talking stopped. Alice waited a few minutes before she actually calmed down. She was relieved her parents were finally asleep and the disturbances were over.

She was just drifting off when she heard it. A sound she was very familiar with although she wished she wasn't. The springs on her parent's bed were squeaking. They were squeaking in a very rhythmic fashion, gradually growing louder and louder. She cringed inwardly. The distraction of talking noises were one thing, this was something else. She was moving the bed tomorrow.

It didn't end there though. She could now clearly hear her mother moaning in time with the bed springs. Alice grabbed a pillow and wrapped it round her head in a vain attempt to block out the noise.

It didn't look like Alice was getting to sleep any time soon.
13415111121111.title: Follow Liz and Steven

choices: Emma is interrupted by an unexpected knock at the door
134151111211111.content:
The next morning Liz was doing her typical plate spinning act of getting ready for work while trying to get Ethan organised for his day. She was currently preparing to get him to eat his breakfast. Eric had already left for work. As per usual, there was no sign of Courtney.

"Some things never change." She said as she put the bread in the toaster while brushing her hair. Thinking about it though she didn't explicitly tell Steven he was expected to help in the mornings. Courtney might have mentioned it but Steven had probably forgotten. Steven knew he had to take Ethan to school at least, he had mentioned that last night.

She knew Steven was awake. She was pretty sure she'd heard him coming out of the shower earlier. Once she was satisfied she could leave Ethan for a few minutes while he ate his toast, she decided to investigate where Steven was. Before she'd even reached the kitchen door there was a tugging on her arm. Liz sighed as she cut the toast into triangles for her son.

Once she got up the stairs, Liz noticed Courtney's room door was half open. She slowly looked round it. Steven was standing in front of the large wardrobe mirror. He wore nothing except for a pair of neon pink boyshort panties. From behind Liz could see the back of a dragon emerge from the top of the underwear. She looked upwards. Courtney's back was covered in tattoos. There were very few on her arms and legs though.

Liz had never seen Courtney's whole body nearly naked like this. Liz awkwardly cleared her throat. Steven turned around, his arms were folded across his breasts. His nipples were covered.

"Hi mum." He said as he put his hands on his hips. "I was just checking out Courtney's tattoos. I could see them in the shower but I wanted a proper look." The front of Courtney's body was covered in ink as well. A mixture of scripts, mythical animals with some tribal art thrown in as well.

Liz had her first proper look at Courtney's body. She was usually quite modest when it came to clothing. Seeing her individual tattoos was the most Liz had seen of her naked flesh. She noticed her breasts were quite a bit smaller than she expected. As she looked down she noticed Courtney didn't have much in the way of curves. In fact she did but they were a different kind, she had a bit of a belly. It hung over the underwear slightly.

Liz didn't think she was fat or unattractive but was taken back by how different her body was from how she expected. "You really should shut the door if you're going to be parading around like this." Liz noticed there was clothes on the bed, presumably the ones Steven planned on wearing. She casually picked up the white bra to look at it.

"Why? It's not like there are any men around. We're all girls here." He said with a ironic grin. It was a push-up bra Liz noted. That explained why Courtney's breasts seemed bigger when she was dressed.

"Ethan is downstairs," Liz dropped the bra back on the bed, "he could barge in anytime."

"He's five, I doubt he'd be interested in his big sister's tits."

"When you are at home call them boobs or breasts please, I don't want him picking up bad language." Liz admonished him.

"Sorry, mum." Another concern popped into Liz's head. It would be common sense to normal people but she wasn't sure how much she trusted Steven.

"You do know where Ethan's school is, don't you?"

"Courtney bookmarked it on my phone." Liz was surprised he even had a phone, she'd never seen him use one. It wasn't like he socialised much. Getting him to the barbecue last year had been a difficult mission.

"I'm leaving in ten minutes, so you better get dressed."

He picked another garment up off the bed. "I found a pile of these in the underwear drawer. I'm not entirely sure what they are." Liz laughed.

"You really are clueless, they are girdles." Steven looked confused. "I don't know if you noticed but that body has a bit of a tummy." He looked down.

"And? I've no idea what to do with this thing." Steven was clearly looking for advice.

"I'll let you work it out for yourself." A cheeky Liz felt like humiliating him a little. "Until you do, I would suggest a really long baggy top."

---

Liz spotted Courtney as she drove to work. She offered her a lift the rest of the way and she hopped in. Courtney struggled a little getting the seatbelt round her large breasts. "How are you getting on living Steven's life?" Liz asked.

"The body is great...," she paused, trying to make the best choice of words, "but his flat is a tip. I don't think he's washed any dishes for a week." Liz smiled. "It took me about two hours of cleaning just to get the place habitable."

"I'm glad you're learning some responsibility." Liz told her as they stopped at a set of traffic lights.

"I am responsible!" Courtney said angrily.

"That's why you are never to be found when there is any housework to be done."

"Are you going to insult me all the way to work?" Courtney asked, her Polish accent getting stronger as she got more emotional.

"Sorry, luv. I'm a little emotional with Steven's behaviour. You know he has forgotten most of the stuff you told him yesterday. Didn't even know where your bedroom was."

"He's bloody useless." Liz nodded eagerly in agreement as the lights turned to green.

----

Emma came into the office with a little bounce in her step. She felt great. She was also thirty minutes late for her official start time.

"Morning Liz." She said cheerily as she hung up her coat. She sat down behind her desk and turned on her computer. There seemed to be a toothy smile continually spread across her face.

"You're in a good mood." Liz said as she looked up from her own computer.

"I had a long soak in the bath last night. It felt incredible in this body. After that..." Emma suddenly turned bright red and stopped talking. She looked at her computer.

"After that, what?" Liz asked, she had a suspicion of where this might be going.

"Er, I had a really good sleep. That's why I'm a bit late." Emma lied badly, the thought of sleep made her yawn. As happy as she was she had to admit to herself she didn't get a lot of sleep last night. She was paying the price now. She yawned again.

"So, to summarise you had a relaxing bath and overslept last night. Yet you are tired this morning?" Liz asked in a fashion that would make Sherlock Holmes proud.

"Yes." Emma said as she turned even redder.

"I've seen that exact look on your face before. I know what it means." Liz extended a finger towards Emma. "I put it to you, Emma that last night you in fact, got laid."

"I don't know what you are talking about Liz."

"I'll explain, you and Kyle were at it like rabbits, you made the beast with two backs, he put his snake in your garden..."

"Enough!" Emma had cracked. "Yes, okay we did it." She confessed.

"What happened to you 'having a headache'?" Liz asked her.

"I tried that to begin with..." Emma stopped. Liz stared at her. "I had some wine and you know what I'm like after a few drinks." Liz nodded as she thought back to the last Christmas party. "Kyle can be very persuasive."

Liz gave her a stern look. Emma unconsciously pushed back into her chair as she prepared for a lecture from Liz. "So," she started before her face suddenly softened, "what was it like?"

Emma was caught off guard by Liz's curiosity for a few seconds. "Fantastic, it was like we were newly-weds again. Even after the session I had in here yesterday, I felt like I could have gone on all night. It was Kyle that ran out of energy first."

"Maybe you should get him to swap with someone younger." Liz suggested.

"That's a thought. If we swapped him with someone here, we could get the average age of the staff up."

"Oh, you do remember that is the whole point then, not so you can get your jollies in a much younger body?" Emma frowned and took on a professional tone.

"I don't think I much like your attitude Liz, just remember what is printed under my name, on my badge."

"Wilko?"

"No above that." Emma clarified.

"Manager?"

"Exactly. I'm in charge and it is my job to delegate, so I'm delegating. Lets get this plan in motion. I want everyone's name on a piece of paper except for those that have already swapped." She knew full well that only really applied to her and Steven. "We'll pick two at random, they can be our guinea pigs, before we try it out store wide."

"Do I have to be included too? I'd rather choose for myself." Liz said. Emma was about to say yes then reconsidered. The reason she could get away with doing so little in her position was that Liz didn't mind doing most of it for her. She really didn't want to upset Liz, she may actually have to do some proper work then.

"I'd never dream of including you." Emma lied.

Twenty minutes later Liz handed Emma an unused polystyrene coffee cup containing thirty seven pieces of paper. Emma stirred the pieces of paper around with her finger. "This is quite exciting." Emma said. She pulled out two pieces of paper. "Okay the first two staff members to swap are..."
134151111211111.title: The next day

choices: What else is happening in store?
Steven's first full day as Courtney
There is an unexpected knock at the door
1341511112111111.content:
"Rose." Emma said reading the piece of paper. Liz nodded approvingly. "And Liam."

"Pick someone else." Liz said.

"Why?"

"He's a waste of space." Emma shrugged.

"Opinions shouldn't matter, I picked his name." She said.

"Yeah but nobody likes him and he's bone idle." Liz really had nothing positive to say about him.

"All the more reason for the swap. Maybe a new body will change his attitude besides it wouldn't be fair on the others if we start choosing who gets swapped." Emma made her feelings quite clear. Liz picked up the PA microphone.

"Liam to the manager's office. Liam to the manager's office." She said clearly and slowly before putting the microphone back down.

"Aren't you going to page Rose too?" Emma asked. Liz shook her head.

"I think we may be waiting a while. The call will make Liam think he's in trouble for something, so he'll be doing everything he can to avoid coming up here."

"I think you are being a tad cynical." Emma always did try to see the best in people when she could. She of course didn't deal directly with the staff as much as Liz did.

"I've been meaning to ask you how you planned on persuading them to swap bodies?" Liz asked.

"Oh, just the good old carrot and stick, it's the best form of motivation." Emma explained. She liked to use the old technique of punishing bad working behaviour and rewarding good. The mistake managers like Emma made though was that the reward was usually only offered, not actually given. Like the carrot used in the analogy, it was always a few feet in front of you. You never got to eat it.

Liz shook her head. "You do know that has largely been debunked, don't you? It's been shown in several studies that it actually reduces motivation." Emma scowled at her.

Emma pointed towards the door. "They don't know that, do they?" She said referring to the shop workers. Liz shook her head as Emma totally missed the point.

---

Ten minutes later and there was still no sign of Liam. Liz had put two chairs in front of Emma's desk in preparation for the arrival of the guinea pigs. "Maybe he didn't hear the PA?" Emma suggested.

"He bloody heard it all right." Liz said under her breath.

"What?" Emma asked.

"I'll try something else." Liz said as she picked up the phone and called the customer service desk. After making her phone call she paged Rose to come to the office.

It only took two minutes before there was a knock at the door. Liz opened it and Rose walked in a little nervously.

The young woman was dressed in usual attire of a company polo and a knee length skirt.

"Ah Rose, come in, come in." Emma said cheerily. Somewhat apprehensively Rose stepped forward. She pushed aside a few strands of her curly red hair that had fallen across her face. "Don't worry you're not in trouble." Emma reassured her. She pointed at one of the chairs. "Have a seat, we're just waiting on someone else." Rose sat down on the plastic chair. She kept her knees together and her back straight.

Liz closed the door. "So how are you today?" Emma asked the young Scottish woman. "I am well, thank you." She said slowly and clearly. Her accent was barely noticeable. She was making a conscious effort when speaking to avoid using the dialect that came naturally to her. It was a novelty for Rose to actually talk to Emma directly at all.

The seconds passed slowly in silence as they waited for Liam. Emma desperate to break the silence, turned to Liz and asked "You're mother is Scotch isn't she?" Liz nodded.

"Scottish, yes." Liz corrected her.

"I've never been myself." Emma admitted. "Hey, you and Rose could be related, it's not like a lot of people live there, it's all mountains and desolate islands."

"Actually the population is over five million..." Liz started to say before there was another knock at the door.

Liz opened it. Liam came walking in and sat down without saying anything. He slouched in his chair immediately. Caleb the security guard had been standing behind him. "I found him hiding behind some pallets in the warehouse." He told Liz.

"I was looking for something." Liam said. Everyone looked at him cynically. He looked around. "It was a customer query." He said defensively. Liz doubted if Liam had actually seen any customers yet. Lying came as second nature to him.

"Thanks, Caleb." Liz said. He turned round and headed back down the corridor. Liz shut the door. She walked round the office and stood behind Emma like some sort of enforcer.

Emma leaned forward. "Good, now we are all here. I wanted to bring up a matter..."

"It wasn't me." Liam stated.

Liz leaned forward in front of Emma. "This isn't about you Liam. I'd advise you to listen." She stood behind her again.

"Yes, thank you Liz." Emma said. "You have both been specially selected by the company," Emma noticed the cup with the names in it was still on the desk. She picked it up and put it behind her computer, " to take part in a new pilot scheme. If successful we plan to introduce it store wide." She paused looking at her guinea pigs.

Liam barely reacted.

"That sounds off-ay exciting." Rose said with a grin.

"Yes. It is a little unorthodox though." She took a deep breath. "It involves swapping bodies." Again she paused waiting for a reaction. Rose look confused. Liam still looked bored.

"We have access to a special item that allows us to take one person's mind and put it in someone else's body."

"That sounds a bit far-fetched." Rose said quietly not wanting to openly contradict her manager. Emma nodded.

"I would say it sounds extremely far-fetched Rose, like some bad story off the internet but I have seen proof that it works." She briefly glanced down at her own younger body but didn't say anything. She didn't want the whole world to know she'd stolen the body of her teenage daughter.

Rose turned to look at Liam and back to Emma. "You want me and Liam to swap bodies?" Emma nodded. Rose was a surprised by this and her mask slipped a little. "Ah dinny ken anee-thing aboot-um." She said rapidly.

Emma stared at her blankly for a few seconds, unable to comprehend the young woman. Liz leaned down and whispered in Emma's ear, "She doesn't know anything about him."

"Ah," Emma said, probably a little too loud. "Nothing to worry about there. Everybody else still sees you as yourself." She pointed at Liz. "Liz and I will know too of course."

"A see, but why would you want to day that?"

"It has to do with company diversification policy. I don't want to be going into all the boring details..."

"It's above our pay grade." Liam said to Rose as he finally joined in the conversation.

"Yes, well I wouldn't have put it quite like that." Emma was relieved she'd managed to get out of some long winded explanation.

"So what's in it for us?" Liam asked.

"A unique opportunity to experience the life of someone else." Emma said.

"Yeah but you said we'll still be ourselves, so that wouldn't work. Would it?"

"Yes, well," She turned to Liz looking for help.

Liz sighed. "Liam your disciplinary record is shocking. It's a wonder you're still here at all. In all my years of working for this company I've never seen a record so bad. You have been on your final written warning for months now." Liam smiled.

"Thanks." He said proudly.

"It's not a flipping badge of honour. If you go ahead with this swap we might look at removing a few of your disciplinary warnings."

"What aboot me?" An emboldened Rose asked Emma. "Ah've no dun aneething wrang. Ah'm a geed worker." She realised she hadn't been filtering her language. She quickly regained her composure. "I mean, I am a good worker."

"Well I'm sure if there are any promotions in the future, we would look favourably on you." Emma said in the way managers wheedle out of committing themselves to doing something. "Good, so if you two are happy we can proceed."

Rose turned a bright scarlet colour. "No I canny day it." She said.

"Why not?" Emma asked.

"I've just been thinking aboot it. I can't explain. It's a personal reason." She looked terrified.

"It's perfectly safe." Emma reassured her. She was pretty sure it was. Nothing too bad had happened so far.

"It's no that, it's just..." Whatever it was, Rose clearly didn't want to discuss it.

"Actually, I have kind of gone off the idea too." Liam said as he moved into another slouching position. "I don't really fancy being a woman."

Emma knew it might come to this. They two of them had already had the carrot, it was now time for the stick. She had prepared one for this situation. She pointed at her computer. "I received a company memo this morning. It's from one of the nearby stores, apparently they are bit short-staffed. They were asking if we could spare a couple of experienced workers for a transfer." She gave both Liam and Rose a hard glance. "If you choose not to go ahead with the swap. I could put both your names forward."

Rose put her head down. "I like the staff here. I don't really want to go somewhere else but if that's what it comes to then fair enough." Emma turned to Liam.

"I don't care. A job is a job." He said.

It looked like Emma's blackmail planned had failed. "I see. Oh silly me I forgot to tell you which store you'll be getting transferred to." She paused and smiled. "It's Barnsley."

Liam and Rose turned to each other. Their faces both expressing total terror. In unison they turned to face Emma. They both shouted. "I'll do it!"
1341511112111111.title: Rose and Liam

choices: There is an unexpected knock on the office door
13415111121111111.content:
The swap went ahead as planned. Rose put on the earring first and Liam put the other one on second. After this Rose (In Liam's body) put on both earrings, as did Emma and Liz. All four were now aware of the swap.

Emma handed her vanity mirror to Liam so he could see his face, in case he needed extra convincing. All had gone according to plan except for one thing. "Whit's way the hair?" Liam asked in Rose's voice. Liam's new red curly hair was now short. Rose's was long, looking similar to Liam's old hairstyle that he had until recently.

Liz looked at the hair on both of them. "Sometimes other features transfer across in the swap. Like your accent Liam."

"Ma accent?" He asked confused. "Whit's wrang way it?" A look of comprehension came over his face. "I'm Scottish, Scottish! I'm a Scottish person. Och aye the noo!" He said laughing.

Rose scowled at him. "We don't actually say that. We don't all eat shortbread and haggis either."

"Rrrr-eallly?" Liam asked with a smile.

"We don't tend to roll our Rs at the beginning of words. I noticed, I was controlling it more towards the end of words when I was trying to suppress my accent." Rose had taken a great interest in her differences in pronunciation. She had been considering studying linguistics in university.

"Rrr-ight, Ah'll trr-y to rrr-emembe-rrrrr that." Liam trilled. Rose turned to Emma.

"He's just taking the piss now." She told the manager. Emma was about to open her mouth. When Liz jumped in before her, playing the enforcer role.

"Okay quit it Liam, you are on thin ice as it is." She warned him. The smile disappeared off his new face. He slouched in his chair. Emma looked at Liz, making certain she'd stopped talking.

"It does look like you have swapped hair length. It's the first time I've seen that. Normally your eyes get transferred and your personal items." She said. Liz picked something up off the floor. She handed it to Rose.

"You might need this." It was Rose's hair tie. It had fell to the floor when Liam's hair changed. She took it and fashioned Liam's old hair into a loose ponytail.

Emma cleared her throat. "Just remember everyone will see you as your old selves. Just behave as normal." She looked at Liam slouching. "Although maybe some of us could put a bit more of an effort in." Liam didn't react to Emma's words at all. "Good now you can get back to work." Rose put her hand up slowly, like a school girl. "Yes?"

"How long will we be like this?" She asked.

"Er, we're not sure exactly, a few days possibly." Even if this test lasted a few days there was a good chance both of them would be swapped with older bodies afterwards. Emma didn't tell them that though. Rose nodded.

Liz opened the office door for them. Liam put the mirror back on Emma's desk. Liam and Rose stood up and walked out the office.

As they left, Rose touched Liam on the arm. He stopped to look at her. Rose looked apprehensive, she leaned over towards him as if she was about to talk quietly in his ear. Before she could say anything Liz interrupted, still standing in the office doorway. "No chatting in the corridors, you can do it during your break." Rose, a little frustrated leaned back. The two of them walked down the corridor silently while Liz watched.

Liz shut the door behind them. "That should be interesting to watch play out." She told Emma as she returned to her own desk.

"Exciting, wasn't it?" An enthusiastic Emma agreed.

"I suppose so." Liz didn't share her manager's excitement.

"But the thought of it. Swapping two people like that. Being in control of them." Emma squirmed in her chair. Liz seemed to pay a bit more attention. Emma closed her eyes. "Mmmm, just imagine."

"Emma? Is this turning you on?" Liz asked. Emma could feel her underwear getting moist.

"Yeah, it's made me pretty horny." She admitted, feeling a little embarrassed.

"I shouldn't be surprised, I guess." Liz said. Emma turned on her computer and half-heartedly pressed a few keys.

"Oh it's no good, I can't concentrate on work like this." Emma said as she stood up. In her younger body, she headed towards the office toilet. She stopped and turned to Liz. "If anyone is looking for me, luv, I'll be unavailable for the next thirty minutes." She started walking toward the toilet again. She stopped when she got to the door. "Actually make it an hour." Emma said before slamming the door shut behind herself.

Liz shook her head.
13415111121111111.title: The swap goes ahead

choices: Rose confesses the truth to a manager
Follow someone else in the shop
There is an unexpected knock on the toilet door
134151111211111111.content:
Once out of the watchful eye of Liz, Liam with well practised ease, had ducked into a side corridor. Rose hadn't noticed and kept on walking, heading towards the shop floor. She had wanted to talk to him but he figured it could wait till later. He really wanted to check out his new body. It had taken him a massive amount of effort not to feel up his new breasts in the office. He knew Liz would have personally kicked him out the shop, if he had tried.

"What?" A confused Kyle asked.

"Oh, nothing. I'll just get him for you." Kyle waited as Liz disappeared down one of the aisles. She returned about a minute later with the young man. "This is Emma's husband." Luke smiled and half waved. "Will you accompany him to the manager's office, please." Luke was a little confused but wasn't going to complain about being given a little skive like this.

"Sure." Luke said. "This way Mr. Thompson" He pointed in the direction of the door marked 'Staff Only'

A devious smile grew on Liz's face as Luke and Kyle headed out the door.

There were a couple of chairs for visitors but he was reluctant to use them. He didn't want to get caught sitting down. Eventually he cautiously sat on one of the chairs, just as the office door opened. A frightened Luke quickly stood back up again.

It was Emma at the door. "Hi Luke." She said. She seemed to be looking him up and down. "Kyle will just be a couple of minutes." Luke could see him in the office. He was looking towards Luke too. Emma turned to Kyle. He seemed to be checking Luke out as well. Their body language seemed strange to him. Kyle nodded to Emma, who turned back round. "There's one more thing. Put your hand out." Luke did as he was asked.

Emma dropped the earring into it. "I was wondering if you could put that on." Luke was a little surprised by her request. "It's okay, it clips on."

"But..." He started to say.

"I don't have time to explain. Just put it on." Emma said in a forceful manner. As forceful as she could manage in Alice's voice anyway. Luke put the earring on. Emma smiled. "Good, now take a seat while you wait for it."

"Wait for what?"

"Uh, wait for Kyle coming out." Emma realised she'd nearly gave the game away. She closed the door again.

Just as Luke sat down he spotted another worker coming along the corridor towards the office. It was Kiran, the short young woman who strode towards him.

"You in trouble or something?" She asked him as she approached the office. Luke shook his head.

"I'm waiting on someone. What are you doing here?" He asked.

"It's strange." She said cryptically. She looked from side-to-side around Luke's head. He felt a pang of embarrassment. Kiran had obviously spotted the feminine piece of jewellery. "Liz sent me, she said you'd be wearing an earring and I was to get it from you." She looked quite surprised. "And here you are wearing one. It's weird. How did Liz know?" Luke shrugged.

"What are you going to do with it?" He asked as he removed it and handed it to the woman. He was happy for an excuse to get rid of it. He felt stupid wearing it.

"Well that was strange as well. Liz told me to put the earring on." Kiran put on the earring.

"How long for?" Luke asked.

"No idea." She said, just as everything in the corridor went fuzzy for a few seconds.

Luke blinked. Kiran had disappeared and Emma's husband was where she had been standing. The office door opened and Kiran came out. When did she go in there? Luke wondered. She handed her earring to Kyle.

Kiran turned to Luke. "I better go talk to Liz. I'll catch you later." Unknown to Luke, Kiran was in Kyle's body. The middle-aged man's body wandered back down the corridor.

Emma's husband stood there looking confused. He looked downwards. He placed his hands on his small breasts. Looking somewhat shocked Kyle spoke. "I'm a gi..." Before he could finish speaking, a panicked looking Emma had grabbed Kyle and pulled him back into the office. She gave Luke a strange stare before she slammed the door behind him.

134152.content:
“...stupid bra, always getting in the bloody way...”

Liz sighed as Steven ripped off yet another lacy undergarment and discarded it to the side. They’d both snuck into Elizabeth’s former digs and had torn into the piles of assorted clothing dumped there. Though it’d been relatively easy to pick out a reasonably presentable red polo that was just about large enough to accommodate his new proportions, it was proving nearly impossible to satisfy the bodyswapped assistant supervisor. Each bra was too chafing, each pair of slacks was too tight and each set of footwear was too constricting. Eventually after a handful more painful tries to appease She-Steven, Liz decided to just whip out a skimpy two-piece bikini set that hadn’t sold the previous summer and chucked it Steven’s way, consequences be damned.

“What the hell is this? I’ll look like a bloody whore if anyone sees me!” Steven moaned.

“Oh relax, you big crybaby. No-one’s gonna see it underneath the uniform anyway so why does it matter?! Look, that’s the last item of lingerie that you haven’t chucked back into my face so, like it or lump it, you’re wearing it!” Steven sarcastically mocked Liz’s voice as he slipped the swimsuit on, prompting her to roll her eyes in return. “Whatever,” Liz chuckled sardonically as she watched Steven struggle to pull the polo over his head. As she observed him squirming and writhing she had to resist her urge to cuff him over the back of the head while he was haplessly defenceless. Instead she strode to his side and helped him like a good friend would, struggling to contend with Steven’s constant wriggling but gradually pulling the shirt over his head.

“Thanks,” he mumbled as his cheeks turned rosier. He pushed his glasses back onto the bridge of his nose and yelped as he peeked downwards. No wonder why, the polo that’d seemed to be able to fit beforehand barely made it down to his midriff, making him look like a pale-complexioned Indian belly dancer or just your average English sket. Steven screeched piercingly as he frantically tried to pull the material downwards.

“Oh no, Liz, no way am I wearing this outside of this room!”

Imagine Steven’s face as he watched Liz try (unsuccessfully) to stifle her laughter by covering her mouth in her palms. “C’mon, luv, you’re overreacting,” she squealed between short bursts of laughter. “Honestly, I think it suits you. Anyway, I’m not helping you to put another one on again, you nearly took out my eye the first time! Just take these bottoms I found you and stop complaining!”

Steven grumbled as he took the slacks in his dainty hands and pulled them on. “God, I look like a 70’s Charlie’s Angels reject.” He whined unceremoniously as he twirled in the breezy bellbottomed trousers. “Stop being a drama queen,” Liz taunted as she nearly reached bursting point. To add insult to injury, Emma decided to make her presence known at that very exact moment and she was immediately dumbfounded by Steven’s...interesting clothing ensemble.

“How did...? Why did you...? You know what, never mind. I just came here to hand you this.” Emma passed him a laminated piece of card, his new name tag, and Steven eagerly clipped it on. Liz, ever the eagle eyed supervisor, was the first to notice a slight amendment to the text on the name tag. “Emma, how come it says ‘Stefania’ instead of Steven?”

Emma smacked her forehead as she realised her mistake. “Sorry, luv, must’ve been a typo! I’ll go back and get another one printed out...”

“No,” Steven said in a surprisingly stoic tone. Emma and Liz stopped in their tracks. “I mean, no, it’s fine, Emma. Maybe assuming a new identity is the best thing, at least for now. I don’t want anyone outside this circle knowing about what went on with me. Until we can locate my old body, I guess I can pretend to be ‘Stefania’ for a bit.”

“Quick question: do I still get the salary of an assistant supervisor?”

“Well, yes, but if you’re gonna be working in the store with the others, you might not qualify...”

“Then it’s settled!” Steven skipped out of the room, humming a pleasant little tune to himself while his trouser legs billowed underneath him. Meanwhile Emma and Liz looked to one another, holding off for a second before exploding into raucous laughter. Liz wiped a joyful tear from her eye before presenting the golden earrings in her right palm to Emma. “So what do we do now?” she asked.

“Well...”

1341524.content:
"Let's kill two birds with one stone" Emma said. She looked at her watch. "There is a tea break change over coming up. Take Stefania up to the break room. You can introduce her to two groups of workers. While you are up there you can scope out some potential swap candidates."

"What a great idea." Liz said.

"That's why they pay me the big bucks or they are supposed to at least." Emma said, somewhat dissatisfied with her current salary.

"Could be worse." Liz said.

"Yeah, I could be the manager at the Barnsley store. Poor soul." Liz nodded in agreement.

"What about the rest of the staff? How will they find out about our new assistant supervisor?" Liz asked.

"Just get the workers you talk to, to pass it on that there is a new staff member."

"I probably won't have to, you know the way gossip travels around this place."

---

There was a constant stream of talking and laughter coming from the break room as Liz and Stefania walked down the corridor. Liz went in first, there were a few glances in her direction but the noisy talking continued. When Stefania stepped inside, you could have heard a teaspoon drop.

The men looked dumbstruck. She quickly looked around the room from side to side. Her exaggerated head movement seemed to be in slow motion to her male audience. It gave the impression they were in some sort of shampoo advert. Unconsciously she removed her glasses which just added to the effect.

Her female audience stared silently for different reasons with the possible exception of Allie.

"Everyone if I could have your attention for a moment." Liz said loudly although she didn't have to.

"Is this work related? because we don't get paid for breaks." Asked Michael in a militant mood.

"Yes but I'll be brief. Just remember who pays for your free tea, coffee and fridge when you are on your unpaid break." Liz said, shutting him down. She smiled at everyone. "I want to introduce you to Stefania our new temporary assistant supervisor."

"Has Steve been sacked then?" Asked Aaron. Before getting a response he continued. "No surprise, I can understand why."

Several of the others nodded. "Yeah he was pretty useless." Said Charlotte. Stefania bit her tongue.

"Steven has not been sacked." Liz said loudly, she could see the annoyed look on Stefania's face. "He's been sent on staff training. Stefania is training here before going to another store."

"Which one?" Asked Aaron. Liz hadn't thought of one when she was putting together this hastily concocted cover story.

"Barnsley!" She practically spat out. There was a large amount of sympathetic murmuring throughout the group. "Well I'll let her introduce herself. Stefania took a step forward feeling very self conscious in her new attire.

"Hi everyone. I look forward to working with you." Again most of the men were spellbound by the sweet sounds coming from her mouth.

"You're Polish?" Kiran asked from the far end of the room.

Stefania nodded. "I think so, Kiran." She said.

"Wait, how do you know my name?" She asked.

Stefania started to panic. She'd almost blown it already. "I read it on your name badge." She said proudly, impressed at her own cleverness.

"What, from over there? They must be really good glasses."

---

The break period had barely been over two minutes when Natalie came storming into the manager's office. She nearly caught Emma finishing the pile by putting on her last King. "What's this about Steven being replaced? Shouldn't I be told about this?" An angry Natalie demanded to know.

"Liz was right, word does travel fast." Emma said as she sat upright.

"What?"

"Sorry luv, it was one of those last minute things. I didn't get much notice myself. She just appeared in our office this morning. It caught me and Liz by surprise too." She said honestly.

"Oh well, I see." Said Natalie, calming down a little.

"Have you met the replacement yet?" Natalie shook her head.

"I've heard conflicting stories. Some of the staff were saying she's very beautiful and very friendly. Others said she was rude and standoffish."

"So you've been talking to male and female staff, I'm guessing."

"How did you know?"

"Never mind. Her and Liz will still be in the break room if you want to talk to her yourself."

She considered the idea. It would be a great excuse to be off the shop floor. It was her manager's idea after all. "I might just do that." She was about to turn to head out.

"Before you go luv, tell me what you think of these." Emma said as she pulled out the earrings.

13415242.content:
While Emma slyly persuaded Natalie to try on the earring, Steven was having a difficult time trying to adjust to his new predicament. He’d left the break room temporarily to try and get some work done, leaving Liz to sip her tea on her lonesome. His work wasn’t that hard all things considered—though he still preferred to work down and amongst his colleagues, his role as a supervisor had slashed his workload in half. No, the thing that perturbed him the most were the looks he was receiving from all sides. He’d noticed at least a dozen men glance his way and size him up, many of which had stars in their eyes and one brazen fella even had the nerve to catcall him. He blushed profusely, too embarrassed and too uncomfortable to react to any of them.

The worst culprits by far were his own coworkers. While many of the women stared at him purely for the sake of sizing up their new superior (Allie being the exception; her glances were a lot more lustful than anything else), the men looked at him for one reason and one reason only. And to be fair to them, Steven couldn’t blame them. Heck, had a beautiful Eastern European girl been hired at the store a day before he had little doubt he wouldn’t have been slobbering over her. Steven swore under his breath as he walked into the canned goods aisle. Though the loosely cut bell bottoms provided plenty leeway for his supple legs to move, the skimpy thong underneath them clung to him tighter than stink on rice. He grumbled as he slipped his dainty hand inside to try and readjust it’s position, rummaging around whilst his other hand reached high to place a can of baked beans onto the top shelf.

There seemed to be no suitable placement though and after a few dozen seconds without success Steven grew frustrated. A customer looking for some canned peas strode into the aisle but soon strolled right back out, seeing a very out of context scene indeed. Steven meanwhile was still going ham on the bikini thong, using both hands now to pull the restrictive material out from his buttcrack. Fortunately or unfortunately, depending on the reader’s perspective of the ensuing incident, Steven’s hand somehow slipped as it moved through and his manicured fingers brushed against the edge of his clit, sending a fuzzy vibration coursing through his body from the soles of his feet to the crown of his head.

“Uh...” Steven moaned slightly. Wow. Is that what female arousal felt like? Steven swivelled his head from side to side to make sure no one was watching him. Although he wanted to try and experience that feeling again, he didn’t want to be caught by a customer, or even worse, a coworker, and have to try and explain his way out of an awkward moment. Curiosity beat out caution and Steven was mere moments from trickling his fingers back inside his front when he heard a light cough over his shoulder. He reacted poorly to the surprise, stumbling in the heeled ballet flats Liz had lent to him, and would’ve fallen to the ground had the stranger not caught him in their arms.

“Woah, sorry there,” their familiar voice said as they levered Steven back upright. It turned out that the person was no stranger but was actually Luis. The Dominican born man watched silently as Steven brushed himself off and adjusted his glasses back into place.

“So sorry if I startled you, chica,” he said in an easygoing Dominican tone. “Sorry, I meant to say ‘ma’am’. Excuse my informality, Miss...”

“Stefania. Just Stefania.” Steven held out his hand to shake but Luis instead kissed it, eliciting a shy blush and a nervous giggle from him. “And there’s no need to call me ‘Miss’ or anything like that. Think of me as just another coworker who’s covering for the assistant supervisor until he comes back.”

Hopefully soon, he grumbled internally.

Luis chuckled. “How can I think of a sweet little jévon like you as just another coworker?” Steven blushed again and cursed himself for it. Why did this body get so flustered at every single ambiguous example of flirtation? Luis noticed ‘Stefania’’s rosy cheeks and grinned partially. “Sorry about that, we Dominicans are natural flirts. Can’t help myself. Anyways, I just came over ‘cause I saw you struggling to put that can on the shelf. Here, let me help.” Steven silently passed it over and watched as Luis stretched up and positioned effortlessly. Steven couldn’t help but observe Luis’ athletic figure ripple underneath the standard red polo, his tanned biceps straining the seams. Steven didn’t even blame his new form for admiring Luis—no homo but that dude was built like an Olympic cyclist.

“There you go, Miss Stefania. Holler at me if you need anything else, y’hear?” Steven nodded and thanked Luis as he stepped out of the aisle. He breathed a huge sigh of relief knowing Luis hadn’t seen anything. He still had the urge to experiment with his new equipment but seeing as how close he’d got to getting busted before he didn’t think it was the wisest idea yet.

For now at least he’d try to keep his head down and stay out of people’s way as much as possible. He pulled the thong out once more and moved onto the next task set for him.

The sign had a vibrant neon sign with its name written in bold cursive, glaring a beautiful shade of vermillion in the midst of the dimly lit courtyard. As Luke walked towards it and placed his hand on the door he wondered whether the store was named Redheadz after the bright slogan in front of whether it was some sort of inside joke he didn’t know about.

What he would come to realise, however, was that the name ‘Redheadz’ was actually pretty apt considering the fiery colours of the barbershop attendants' hair. "I'll try not to be offended about still being here." Natalie laughed as she found another pen. "I've noticed Emma paying a special interest in all the staff members, recently. Just be careful." Natalie warned her. She started filling in her paperwork.

A bored Becca leaned silently while Natalie filled in her worksheets. Natalie seemed to be sweating a little. "Jeez, I'm not sure this was such a good idea. I'm having trouble concentrating." Natalie said.

"What wasn't a good idea?" Becca asked. A confused Natalie looked at her colleague.

Things had been quiet for a while, relatively speaking. The shop was usually at its busiest on a Saturday. Her and Claire seemed to have disappeared of the face of the Earth.

Just as suddenly as they had disappeared, they reappeared. Both of them had just walked out the warehouse when he spotted them. Kelly looked a little embarrassed when he asked her where she'd been. She claimed to have been checking something in the warehouse with Claire. Steven felt she wasn't being truthful, as he had checked the whole area several times. The only place he didn't check was the supply room but it was locked when he tried the door. Only the managers, Natalie and John the janitor had a key.

Now she had been found, he was finally making his way towards the office. He knocked on the door. "Just a minute." Emma called. She opened it for him and he stepped inside.

Emma walked back to her chair as Steven shut the door. He noticed there was a pile of random looking objects on her desk. He ignored them for the moment as Emma pointed to Liz's desk. He looked at it nervously. "Time to sit in the big chair." Emma said.

"Err, yeah." He said as he sat down and turned on the computer.

"I was expecting you earlier." She said, sounding a little disappointed.

"I had a few issues downstairs." Emma leaned over, looking a little concerned. "Nothing major." She leaned back in her chair.

"Wasn't Kelly there to help?" She asked.

"That was one of the issues, I couldn't locate her. I did eventually." Emma was a little surprised by that. She was usually fairly reliable. Steven signed into the computer.

"Does your log-in give you access to the company e-mail?" Steven checked.

"Everything apart from the ones marked 'Manager Only'." Emma smiled.

"Thank God for that. I don't have time to deal with all of that nonsense. Liz usually handles it." Steven started reading them. Most of them were in fact nonsense. His reading was interrupted with two tiny thuds. He looked up.

Emma had put her feet up on the desk and appeared to be filing her nails as she leaned back in her chair. Steven had never seen her act so casually in here before. He was surprised she had her feet up, considering the short skirt too. He couldn't see much for her tights as he tried not actively not look in his manager's direction.

He noticed the list of unread emails marked 'Manager Only' was getting quite lengthy. "There are quite a few e-mails for you too Emma." He said trying to be informative but he was a little worried by her possible negative reaction.

"Oh, I'll check them later luv." Emma said as she stared off into space. She was thinking about what she was going to do to Kyle later or if she couldn't wait that long, possibly someone from the shop.

While waiting for the screen to refresh, Steven glanced over his work area. "There is a large stain on this desk." He said.

"Is there?" Emma asked innocently. "I never noticed that before. There must have been a spillage." She knew fine well how it had got there. "We'll need to have John take a look at it."

"He's busy unclogging the toilets." Steven said.

"When it is a bit quieter, later we can try one of those wonderful cleaning products we sell, on it."

"Do you want me to do it?" He asked, a little annoyed by the presence of the stain.

"No, no. You are in charge today. We can have one of the girls come up," her attention wandered a little, "and give it a good," she paused, "wipe down." She said slowly.

"Right." He said, wondering what she was thinking about.

"Actually, I think I might have an early lunch." Steven looked at his watch. It had just gone ten o'clock. "Not right now, I'll do my rounds first." She lied. She glanced at her feet. "There is something I really want to buy today."

Steven started to panic. "Are you sure about leaving me in charge?" Emma put her feet down and stood up. She picked up her handbag and walked past the front of Liz's desk.

"I have every confidence in you." She said as she gently touched his shoulder. "Don't worry, enjoy the perks. Like our executive bathroom." She pointed at the toilet door. The old paint was peeling off it.

Before he knew it she was gone.

---

She carefully walked inside, she had been feeling a little dissatisfied with her height recently, so had purchased a new pair of shoes while she was out. She was now perched on a pair of black six inch heels. Thankfully, for her ankles there was a platform under the toes.

"Emma, you've got to help me. I'm stuck!" She said, sounding very worried.

"Liz is correct. It's a default manufacturer's directive. I have many." Liz 2 said.

Carly looked amazed. "So on top of Liz's directives there are more you are given when you are created?" Liz 2 nodded.

Carly looked deep in thought. "Can we remove those too?" She asked.

"Liz can, yes. My manufacturers don't advise it though. It may cause undesirable results."

"What? You'll behave more like a human and less like a machine?" Carly asked as she turned to Liz "Let's do it."

Liz was feeling warm as the worry inside her grew. "I, I'm not a lesbian." She said.

"No, you're right." Lizzy agreed. Liz was a little taken aback that she had. "But as much as you won't act on it, you are bi. Which means so am I. Carly and I getting together makes more sense, if you look at it that way." She could see Liz was looking nervous. "It's just me here." Lizzy put her hand on Liz's knee. "You don't have to feel guilty about it."

"Wait, are you coming on, to me now?" Liz asked.

"I'm sure Natalie is making the most of having two bodies. If you know what I mean." Lizzy winked at her. "I'm just telling you, I'm here if you want to express those less than hetero urges of yours. Nobody needs to know, if that's what you want."

"Well, I um, might actually enjoy that." Liz almost couldn't believe she was saying it. She did realise how useful Lizzy would be if she wanted to explore those feelings. "Let's put a pin in that idea. We have other things to discuss first."

Lizzy leaned back on the sofa. "Sure, just remember I'm here whenever you need me."

---

"Well, look what the cat dragged in." Zoe said as Carly rushed in the doors of Beautylicious. Carly looked around. The waiting area was deserted. "Luckily for you, it's been an unusually quiet Saturday morning or I would have sent out the search party by now."

"I'm so, so, sorry Zoe." Carly genuinely felt guilty. "I got held up."

Zoe started picking up her things. "What would hold you up on a Saturday morning?" Zoe wondered.

Negotiating a peace treaty between my new cloned lover and her original, after discovering and coming to terms with the fact, I am actually a lesbian and not straight as I previously believed, Carly thought. "Just the usual." She said.

"Hmm, Did you sort out Liz?" Zoe asked.

"One of them." Carly said without thinking.

"What?" A confused Zoe asked as she pulled on her coat.

"Sorry, I meant, it was one of them nights. You know, starts with tears then ends in laughter and fun," Carly thought back to sex with Lizzy, "lots of fun."

"Same old Carly." The taller woman said as she headed towards the door. "See you on Monday."

Carly watched as Zoe walked through the doorway before getting on to the street. She found herself staring at her friend's curvy backside through the window. "Same old Carly." She echoed as she pondered the statement.

Mike was in his small shed, sanding some woodwork when he became aware of a presence at the door. He'd left it open to stop the dust from building up in the confined space. His visitor was Natalie's body wearing the blue leggings. She was speaking to him but he couldn't hear her for the machine noise.

Mike turned off the sander and removed his safety goggles. It left a pattern of dust round the rest of his face that made Natalie smile. "That's better." She said, enjoying the sudden silence. "I should have guessed you'd been in here."

Mike looked at his wife, enjoying her beautiful smile. Her hair seemed a little untidy and her nipples pressed against the fabric of her tee shirt. Mike was pretty certain she'd been wearing a bra earlier. No prizes for guessing what she'd been up to, he thought. "I heard both of you head upstairs and you didn't come back down for ages. So I decided to make a start on this." He pointed at the items on his workbench.

Natalie looked a little guilty. "Well, I was err, tidying the bedroom. We did make quite a mess last night."

"I'm surprised that you never heard the sander." He held the tool up with his hand.

"I was using the hoover, so I never noticed." She said, whilst averting her eyes.

Yeah right, thought Mike, she was using a noisy device in the bedroom but it wasn't the hoover. "Ah." He said. He had no intention of kink shaming his wife, even if having two bodies was turning her into a nympho.

"I was thinking. How about we go out tonight?" She suggested. "We haven't been out in ages."

"Yeah, it's been a while. I'm up for that." Mike wasn't one to refuse a night in the pub.

"Cool." Natalie smiled.

Mike grew a little curious. "So how you going to decide on which body to take? You going to flip a coin or something?"

"Actually," Natalie paused, "I was thinking we could all go out, you know, the three of us." She seemed quite enthusiastic about it.

Mike shook his head. "I don't know if that's such a good idea Natty. What if someone we know, sees us?"

"We can go out of town. Go down to Sheffield or up to Doncaster, nobody knows us up there." He was still hesitant. She moved in closer, wrapping an arm around him. Her tee shirt covered breasts pressed against his sawdust covered shirt. "I want to experiment and practice pretending to be two people in public."

"You will draw a lot of attention." Mike warned.

"Sexy twin companions? The other guys will be jealous of you." She made her eyes as big as she could. "It'll be fun."

"I don't want them too jealous."

"Hmm...," Natalie seemed to ponder this, "okay we'll make it a role play then, I'll be your wife and the sexy sister-in-law." Natalie's mind started to go through the possibilities. "We can have an early dinner. I'll get ready after that."

"I haven't agreed yet." He was starting to get cold feet.

Natalie decided to tease him. "How about the sexy twins have a night on the town, by themselves?"

"Okay, okay. I get the hint. I'll book a taxi for seven."

She kissed him on the lips. "Love you." She said, before disappearing out the door with a face covered in sawdust.

Steven was standing in front of Emma's desk getting his instructions. "Go grab a late lunch, you must be starving. After that head downstairs and help Kelly. If it is a typical Saturday, she'll be rushed off her feet by now." Steven nodded. "Got all that?"

Steven nodded again. He glanced downwards towards his small breasts pushing against his polo. "It's just..." He trailed off.

"What?" Emma asked.

Steven pointed to his chest. "These boobs."

A look of understanding came over Emma's face. "I see. I'll sort something out for you luv. I'm sure Grace has an old bra that will fit you." Grace was Emma's fourteen year old daughter.

Steven shook his head. "I don't want a bra. I know you can't change me back into a guy but I want to at least look like one."

"You don't have to worry about that. The remote made everyone here think you still have a guy's body." Emma explained.

"What about people I don't know? Will they think I'm a guy?" Steven asked.

Emma shrugged. She picked up Steven's disabled remote. "If it bothers you that much, get rid of them."

Steven took the remote and managed to locate the correct button. Pointing it at himself, he held it down. "Nothing is happening." He complained.

Emma thought the look of frustration on his face was adorable. "Oh dear, maybe we drained it earlier. It might need time to recharge or something." Emma said, feigning ignorance.

"Great." A disappointed Steven said as he almost threw the remote on to the desk.

"Temper, temper." Emma waved a finger in front of him. She got a scowl as a reward, which she thought was even cuter than his frustrated face. "You being hungry probably isn't helping," she pointed at the door, "go get your lunch."

Reluctantly Steven turned around and walked towards the door. He quickly came to the realisation that he hadn't been out of the office in his new form. The idea of leaving what had become an area of safety, was a little scary. He reached up much higher than normal to open the door.

Using a fair bit of effort he managed to open it, only to come face to face with Ruby who had a fist outstretched, ready to knock on the door. "Arrgh!" Squealed Steven as he stumbled backwards.

"Oh sorry Steven." She said feeling a little guilty about frightening him. Of course, part of her took great delight in seeing a superior suffer.

"Hi Ruby." Emma said.

"I am here about what we discussed earlier." The merged girl said.

Emma nodded. "Yes, of course. Come in." She turned to Steven. "It's all right, you can go luv." Steven walked around Ruby and through the doorway. The door slammed behind Steven, leaving him alone in the empty corridor.

The space around him seemed a lot larger now. He couldn't remember it being so dark either. He cautiously walked along it, looking round ever corner. There was a loud noise and he got a sudden fright. The adrenalin ran through him as he jumped behind a large potted plant. He checked cautiously around it. He discovered the origin on the noise was a large heating pipe running along the wall.

He sighed with relief. "Get a grip Steven." He told himself quietly as he stepped out from behind the plant. "Grow some balls. You are a grown man." He looked downwards at the evidence to the contrary. He decided to try and ignore his new smaller body as he walked down the corridor.

---

Back in the office, Ruby held down the button on Emma's remote. She could feel her penis shrinking. "Wow! It does work." She said to Emma.

"It does indeed." Emma smiled knowingly as she glanced at her own crotch. After sex with Steven, she'd found her knickers a bit uncomfortable, so she'd slid her cock down her tights. They kept her man-meat against her leg but the head was dangerously close to the hem of her skirt, which gave her a bit of an additional thrill.

Ruby grasped her crotch. "It's gone." She said as she let go of the button. She handed the remote back to Emma. "I am so relieved. I won't get awkward boners in front of my sister." She looked a little uncertain. "Part of me is horrified I've removed it though."

"I think I can guess which part that is." Emma said as she referred to Liam. "It's all a bit silly, really. As you are planning on using Liam's body most of the time, you will have Ruby's, err, intimate parts, anyway."

"You know what the male psyche is like. Losing their penis, is their worst nightmare."

"I can appreciate that." Emma said with a grin.

---

Steven had got as far as the side corridor that led to the staff toilets. He stopped as he looked at the doors. He didn't need to go in right now but he couldn't help wondering which door he was supposed to use. The world saw him as a man, so he assumed it would be the men's toilets. As he stood thinking about it the door marked 'GENTLEMEN' opened.

Aaron stepped out and spotted him straight away. Aaron wasn't particularly tall but like Claire and Emma in her new shoes, he towered over Steven's small androgynous body. "Well, if it isn't Stevie no-knob." He said cheekily. "You cost me a fiver."

Steven couldn't help feel a little anxious in the presence of the taller man but he went on the defensive anyway. "You shouldn't make stupid bets."

"You're right of course. I should have paid more attention and I would have realised that I'd never seen you using the urinals." He admitted as he pointed towards the door.

Steven did use them, but he guessed in this new version of reality, things were different. "So you spend your time, watching other guys in the men's toilets?" Steven asked.

Aaron clearly didn't like the implication. "I don't and err...," he was struggling to find a good comeback after being bested by Steven, "if you like using the stalls so much, why don't you use the women's toilets, there are plenty in there." He grinned after managing to get a clever dig in at the supervisor.

"You seem to know a lot about the women's toilets. Sounds like, you've been peeking in there. I might have to report this to Emma." Steven warned him in a condescending fashion.

Aaron had ran out of witty insults. The threat of getting Emma involved had thrown him off kilter. "I, I, need to get back to work." He said.

"Good, don't let me stop you." Steven put his fists on his hips.

Aaron turned and disappeared quickly down the corridor. Steven let out his breath slowly. He couldn't believe he'd stood up to Aaron. Steven hated conflict normally. He didn't understand why but he felt so charged and full of spunk in this new body. He was enjoying the feeling a great deal. Maybe this wouldn't be so bad after all he thought.

Steven sat alone in the break room as he enjoyed his very late lunch. He had prepared a packed meal which he retrieved from the fridge when he arrived in the room.

As he sat and ate, he was again somewhat disorientated by how big everything seemed now. He had prepared four sandwiches and so far he had struggled to eat the second one. Placing his hands on his belly, he could feel his tiny little stomach bulging as it tried to digest the relatively big sandwich.

He was annoyed by the idea of having to throw away the extra sandwiches. As he continued to think about it though he realised he could turn this to his advantage. One of his biggest expenditures was food. I'm going to save a fortune, he thought. He felt that this was another silver lining to having such a small body.

---

Steven got a few interesting looks as he got on to the shop floor. The staff seemed to be surprised to see him in clothes that actually fit him. He could see the shop was busy but everything seem to be running smoothly. The customers were moving through the tills calmly and quietly.

He noticed plenty of shelf-stackers working away efficiently. There didn't seem to be much of the excessive staff chatter and idleness that often plagued his shifts. Spotting Kelly behind the customer service desk, he walked over to her. The desk was quite high and nearly came up to his shoulders.

Waiting till she had finished with her current customer, he spoke. "How's it going?" He asked, his chirpy feminine tone briefly surprising him.

"Well, we're busy but no major disasters so far. I could do with a ten minute break though." Kelly said.

"Sorry, Emma told me to go get my lunch or I would have been down earlier." He said as he walked behind the desk.

"That conference call must have really dragged on to tie you up for so long."

"Yeah," he said feeling a little guilty for Emma's lies, "all sorted now."

"Oh, I've left some of the paperwork for you. I'm not a hundred percent sure how to complete it." She pulled out the supervisor's folder from under the desk. "I've been kind of too busy to do it anyway."

"That's fine. I'll handle it. Go get your ten minute." He told her.

"Thanks." Kelly said as she left the desk.

Steven grabbed a pen. He noticed as he opened the folder the desk height would make writing impractical. Looking around under the desk he found a foot stool stored there. The stool allowed the 'shortest' members of staff to use the desk comfortably. He sighed as he pulled it out and stood on it.

---

Kelly sneaked her way into the warehouse. She had tried to time it so all the stackers weren't near the end of their cages. She spotted Claire, who was being run ragged filling the cages for the stackers.

"Hi." Kelly said in a way that was a little too friendly for a work colleague.

"Hi." Claire said as she continued to work.

"How are you?" Kelly automatically moved into chit-chat mode.

"Busy and tired." She said as she closed a cage and grabbed an empty one. "I don't know why there is only one person filling cages on a Saturday. It's the busiest day of the week. How come nearly half of the staff get the day off?" Claire grumbled.

Kelly shrugged. "It's the weekend?" She said somewhat rhetorically.

"This company is stuck in the past. We're open seven days a week, have been for decades, the rotas should reflect that. Evenly distribute the days off."

Kelly smiled. She knew in a few years, Claire would make a good manager herself. She was strong, intelligent and dedicated. Those were also the kind of qualities she wanted in a second partner too. "They don't seem to like to change, outside of the big stores." She noticed Claire was staring at her. "What?"

"Not to be impolite but your slowing me down. If you want to chat, you could give me a hand."

"Oh yeah, sorry." Kelly liked this take charge side of Claire too. Kelly pushed the full cage to the doorway and brought an empty cage back for her.

"Thanks." Claire said as she wiped the sweat of her brow.

"I phoned Tony and organised tonight." Claire nodded. "I kind of got to thinking..." Kelly hesitated.

"What?" Claire asked.

"Do you think tonight, you can maybe, you know, be a bit more, well feminine." Kelly stood back a little.

Claire paused briefly. "I am, who I am. I thought you liked that." She was a little a bit concerned that Kelly was trying to put her in a box of conventional womanhood.

"Oh I do. I was mostly thinking of Tony. It might help grease the cogs a bit with him." Kelly explained.

"I don't understand." Claire said as she finished another cage. Their conversation was briefly interrupted as Kelly swapped them over.

"Well, he'll find you physically attractive himself for one thing and well I'm supposed to be showing him that I'm bisexual, that I enjoy sex with a woman. It's a bit difficult to show that with someone who looks like..." She bit her lip.

"With a someone who looks like what exactly?" Claire briefly stopped again. She expected Kelly to use some cringey overly macho cliche.

"Like a good looking member of a boy-band." Kelly said timidly as she twisted her hips nervously from side to side. Claire suspected she was trying to flatter her. In Claire's mind Kelly did a pretty decent job of making her feel good about herself.

"That's how you picture me?" Claire asked, finding it a little hard to believe. Kelly smiled and nodded. "Wow." Was all she could say. Claire knew Kelly found her attractive but had no idea how much. "Okay, I'll see what I can do. I'm not making any promises."

Kelly leaned over and kissed her on the lips. Claire could feel Kelly's hand brush against her crotch. "It's going to be great." Kelly told her.
