1342421111111111111111111111111111111211.content:
Unlike the hardware store, the salon had been quiet. Although Carly had only a few hours work to do, she wanted it over so she could get back to the flat. It had seemed like an eternity but at long last she was on her way home.

She got off her bus at her stop and as she walked to her flat, her mind started to wander. She wondered what kind of state the place would be in after she had requested that Liz and Lizzy should act amicably towards each other. She half expected to find that they had killed each other either that or they would be in bed together having passionate sex.

Carly smiled as she realised that last thought was actually her having a sexual fantasy. She felt a little guilty about it, not about Lizzy just Liz. Why did one of her closest friends have to be almost identical to her lover? Also since discovering the truth about her sexuality, why was she having so many fantasies about women she knew? Probably because she could, she speculated.

She still didn't fully understand all the implications either. She knew stereotypically lesbian relationships normally consisted of a feminine woman who took on the 'traditional' submissive role and a more masculine partner who took on the dominant role. Even though they weren't in a relationship as such, she wondered if her and Lizzy fit that pattern. Looking down at herself she saw her very fashionable dress and her long varnished finger nails. She thought about how Liz typically dressed in a hoodie and jeans.

In her mind, it looked like it might be the case. Liz wasn't very butch though, she was more of a tomboy, she could still be quite feminine when she wanted. Again she realised she was fantasising about Liz not Lizzy. Maybe Liz hated that tomboyish part of herself and Lizzy would be less that way inclined.

Lizzy and her were going to have to have some long conversations, so she could get to really know her especially now as she didn't have to pretend to be Liz in front of her.

She reached the security door of her building and hoped for the best.

---

When she opened the door of the flat, she immediately heard laughter. That's a good sign she thought. She listened to the conversation as she removed her coat.

"So, I spoke to Luis in Spanish. I think he was impressed." One voice said. Carly easily worked out that was Lizzy.

"You big show off!" The other identical voice said.

Carly walked into the room. Both women were still sat in their previous positions. Assuming they hadn't swapped clothes to mess with her but she dismissed that idea as silly. "I hope you aren't going to tell Liz, everything about last night." Carly said as she sat down beside Lizzy. She gave her lover a peck on the cheek.

"Well, we do have to share information to keep our stories straight." Lizzy said with a huge grin. Carly pouted a little. "I suppose I could skip some of the more intimate details."

"Oh please do." Liz said, still laughing a little. "I don't really want to hear all that stuff."

Lizzy put her hand on Carly's stocking covered knee. "How was work?" She asked.

"Quiet. Zoe was a saint as usual. I don't know why she puts up with my antics." She looked at the two women. "Enough about me, how have you two been getting on?"

"Well," said Liz, "we have made some plans but they are somewhat dependent on you."

"Me?" Carly asked as she pointed at herself, feeling a little surprised.

"Yes, you." Lizzy said. "First off, we assumed that you'd be happy with me being your girlfriend."

"Really?" Carly asked.

"Yes, really." Lizzy said. The next thing she knew Carly's lips were on her own, she could feel the shorter woman's tongue in her mouth.

Liz groaned. "Don't get too excited. You don't know what your signing up for yet." She warned.

Carly pulled away from Lizzy. "What do you mean?"

It took Lizzy a few seconds to regain her composure after the kiss attack. "I was hoping," Lizzy paused. Carly turned to face her again, "that I could move in with you."

Carly blinked for a few seconds. "Oh God, of course." Carly's lips were on hers again.

Liz shook her head. "Chuffing hell Carly. Do you think we can get through more than one sentence before the snogging session starts again?" She asked.

Carly pulled away again. "Sorry, I'm just so very happy." She leaned back against the sofa. "Wait a minute. What about Eric?" She asked Lizzy.

"We were coming to that." Lizzy said as she wiped Carly's lipstick off her mouth. "I'm sorry Carly, I can't change the way I feel. I still love him."

It was clear Carly was a little disappointed, although Lizzy's feelings didn't come as a big surprise to her.

"Thankfully," Liz said as she point to Lizzy, "she is a lot more open-minded when it comes to sex that me. Carly, if this is going to work you will have to be too."

"I don't understand." Carly said.

Lizzy held her hand. "How do you feel about sharing me?" Carly tilted her head. "Liz is going to be living with Eric most of the time as normal but she's agreed," Lizzy took a breath, "that I can take her place at home, one weekend every other week. I'll be Eric's wife and Ethan's mother for those two days." She was really wishing Carly wouldn't be jealous about it.

"I see." Carly said without emotion.

"There's more." Liz said. Carly turned to face her. "I'll need somewhere to live for those two days. I was hoping I could stay here." Carly's eyes darted towards the bedroom.

"You mean, with me?" Carly asked wondering if Liz wanted to share her bed too.

Liz picked up on the implication. "No, no. I just meant crashing on the sofa." She looked at it. "It folds out, right?"

"Yes." Carly said, again there was a hint of disappointment in her voice.

"This isn't set in stone either." Lizzy said. "Other things may crop up, school stuff, holidays, birthdays, things like that. We were just going to plan it as it crops up. You know, improvise." She explained.

Carly mulled it over in her head. "Birthdays?" She asked.

Lizzy nodded. "Well, we'll both probably stay at home, I mean Liz's house on Ethan's birthday."

"How's that going to work?" Carly asked, very confused. Liz and Lizzy looked at each other.

Liz spoke first. "We're going to tell Eric and Ethan the truth. I had planned on doing that anyway."

"They deserve it." Lizzy said. "If Liz and I are taking turns working, it would be fairly hard to explain why we were at home so much. It's just easier all round."

"So Eric will have to agree to this deal too?" Carly asked.

Liz smiled. "I think I, I mean we, can persuade him." She glanced at Lizzy before looking back at Carly. "So what do you say?"

The room was in silence for a few minutes before Carly responded as she thought their proposal over. "I did want you two to hammer out a solution." She paused again. "This is certainly, a solution. It isn't what I expected but I'm not sure what I was expecting." Liz and Lizzy both leaned over in anticipation. Carly smiled. "Sure, lets do this!"

It was Lizzy's turn to lean over and give Carly a long and protracted kiss. Liz watched them. As much as she made fun of them, she was happy that they were happy.

Liz started to fidget a little as the kiss continued. It was starting to feel uncomfortable, watching them for this long. She stood up. "I'll go put the kettle on, we'll have a quick cuppa before we head home." She said in attempt to break the current silence. Neither woman responded.

1342421111111111111111111111111111111211.content:
Eric and Ethan arrived home somewhat earlier than expected. They were sat in the kitchen talking to Courtney about their trip to see Reece.

Eric was talking away about meeting Reece's new girlfriend. Beside him at the kitchen table, Ethan was eating a rather large chocolate biscuit. He was largely being ignored by his father and his sister as they were engrossed in their conversation.

"So," said Eric concluding the story, "I didn't want to feel like we were intruding. That's why we're back early."

"I see." said Courtney as she took a sip of her water. It seemed Reece's new girlfriend was acting a little possessive while Eric was there.

Before any more could be said about the matter, they heard the front door open. Everyone turned their heads to see Lizzy walk into the kitchen. Her and Liz hadn't expected the early return of her husband and son. They had planned on briefing Courtney about the plan. After seeing the car outside they had to improvise.

Courtney stared in surprise. She knew she was looking at Lizzy as she was still wearing Liz's work clothes.

"Oh, hi Liz." Eric smiled as he noticed the work clothes too. "The shop didn't call you in today, did they?" Lizzy shook her head just as Ethan made a lunge to hug her. Lizzy expertly dodged it.

"You can hug me after you've finished that biscuit and washed all that chocolate off your hands." Lizzy told him in a stern tone. Ethan sighed and continued eating the biscuit at an increased rate. Lizzy walked round the kitchen a little.

"Someone was looking for you." Courtney told her as she made a face away from her dad, trying to secretly tell Lizzy about Liz.

"Oh, they found me." Lizzy said, just as the front door slammed shut.

"Who is that?" Eric asked assuming correctly, that whoever it was had travelled with Lizzy.

Courtney nearly spat out a mouthful of water, when Liz walked into the kitchen. She was carrying some shopping bags. "Hi everyone." There were now four adults and one child in the kitchen. "Isn't this cosy." She remarked about the lack of space.

Eric stared silently as he tried to comprehend what was going on.

Without warning, Ethan began crying. "What's wrong sunshine?" Lizzy asked. He was too upset to speak and merely pointed at the floor. The surprise of seeing a second mother had made him drop his biscuit on the floor. Lizzy grabbed another from the packet and he practically snatched it from her hands. The tears quickly receded as he began eating the new biscuit. She turned to look at the group. "We shouldn't be encouraging him, he won't eat his dinner now."

"Courtney?" Eric asked his daughter.

"Yes dad." She replied.

"I think there may be something wrong with me." He look worried. "I hope I'm not having a stroke."

"Can you spell burnt toast?" Courtney asked. Eric shook his head. "That's a good sign."

"Yes but I can see Liz in two different places." He pointed at Lizzy. "She's standing beside Ethan." He turned and pointed at Liz. "I can also see her at the kitchen door. I must be hallucinating."

"Err..., dad?" Courtney said.

"Yes?"

"You're not hallucinating. There are two Lizs in here, well kind of."

Eric sighed with relief. "Thank goodness for that. For a minute there I thought something strange was going on."

"Two mummies." Ethan agreed as he finished his biscuit.

Lizzy grabbed a damp cloth and wiped his little hands, then his face. "I think, the three of us," she pointed at Courtney and Ethan, "should go into the living room. I think Liz needs a long talk with Eric."

Lizzy gently grabbed Ethan's hand and pulled him towards the door. Courtney followed behind them as they walked past Liz.

Liz put her bags down and sat beside her husband. She put her hand on his.

Eric spoke quietly. "Must be a mid-life crisis. A few of the guys at work have had them."

Liz smiled. "It's not a mid-life crisis." She assured him. Depending on how he reacted it might turn into one, she thought.

"What's going on Liz?" He asked, looking confused.

"I've got quite the story for you." She said.

---

Lizzy sat on the sofa. Her arm was over Ethan's shoulder as he sat beside her. His head was leaning against her side.

Courtney was sitting restlessly in one of the chairs. "You could have warned me." She said.

"Sorry, we were planning on it. We didn't expect Eric to be back so soon." She explained.

"Planned?" Courtney asked, sounding a little surprised. Lizzy nodded. "You and Liz got together and actually planned something?" Lizzy nodded again. Courtney was impressed.

"Yes, well quite a lot has changed since yesterday." Before she could explain Ethan interrupted.

"Are you magic, mummy?" He asked as his child logic tried to get around the fact he had two mums. Lizzy and Courtney both smiled.

"You could say that Sunshine." Lizzy told him.

"It's not like Alison and Susan." He said referring to identical twins in his class at school.

"No, not like them." She thought it was quite clever of him to make the comparison. "You'll understand when you are older." She tried to explain.

"Okay." He said, reasonably satisfied with the explanation.

---

Nearly fifteen minutes later and Liz finished telling Eric about Lizzy. About the items from the future, the construct-o-matic, creating her, how Lizzy was different, falling out with her and making up again. She missed out some of the more salacious details. She didn't want to bring those up, until she was sure he was comfortable with the basics.

She had told him about the deal they'd reached with Carly.
